title: General default
context: §172-4 General default. If no person appears and answers within the time allowed, the judge may at once upon motion of the State order a general default to be recorded and the complaint for foreclosure of the government&rsquo;s lien for commutation to be taken as confessed. By the description in the notice &ldquo;to all whom it may concern&rdquo;, all the world is made party defendant and shall be concluded by the default and order. [L 1909, c 90, §4; RL 1925, §573; RL 1935, §1604; RL 1945, §4634; RL 1955, §100-4; HRS §172-4] Rules of Court Default, see HRCP rule 55(b).
